noun.description: A second or further loan; a renewal of a loan, especially under new conditions.

verb.description: To loan for a second or further time; to make a reloan of.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Alexander Hamilton (bap. 1739, d. 1802), physician and obstetrician. From re- + loan<br>early 19th century; earliest use found in John Pickering (1777–1846). From re- + loan.
